# Privacy Policy

**[Instance Name]**

*Last updated: [Date]*

---

## Overview

This privacy policy explains how [Instance Name] collects, uses, stores, and protects your personal information. We are committed to protecting your privacy and being transparent about our data practices.

---

## 1. Information We Collect

### Account Information
- **Username:** Your chosen identifier on the platform
- **Email Address:** Used for account recovery and important notifications
- **Password:** Stored using secure one-way hashing (bcrypt/argon2)
- **Profile Information:** Display name, bio, avatar, banner (optional)

### Content You Create
- Posts (notes) and their metadata
- Media uploads (images, videos, audio)
- Reactions and interactions
- Direct messages

### Automatically Collected Information
- **IP Address:** For security, abuse prevention, and legal compliance
- **Browser/Device Information:** User agent string for compatibility
- **Access Logs:** Timestamps and requested resources
- **Session Data:** For maintaining your login state

### Information From Other Sources
- Profile data from federated servers when you interact with remote users
- Content from remote servers when you view federated posts

## 2. How We Use Your Information

### Service Operation
- Process account registration and authentication
- Display your content to other users
- Enable social features (follows, reactions, etc.)
- Provide search and discovery features

### Communication
- Send service-related notifications (account security, policy updates)
- Deliver push notifications if enabled
- Respond to support requests

### Security and Safety
- Prevent abuse, spam, and unauthorized access
- Enforce our Terms of Service
- Investigate reports and complaints
- Comply with legal requirements

### Service Improvement
- Analyze usage patterns (in aggregate) to improve features
- Debug technical issues
- Optimize performance

## 3. Legal Basis for Processing (GDPR)

If you are in the European Economic Area (EEA), we process your data under the following legal bases:

| Purpose | Legal Basis |
|---------|-------------|
| Account creation and service provision | Contract performance |
| Security and abuse prevention | Legitimate interest |
| Legal compliance | Legal obligation |
| Analytics and improvement | Legitimate interest |
| Marketing communications | Consent (where required) |

## 4. Federation and Data Sharing

### ActivityPub Federation
This instance participates in the federated social web using the ActivityPub protocol.

**What is shared with other servers:**
- Your public profile information (username, display name, bio, avatar)
- Your public posts and media
- Your public follow relationships
- Reactions to remote posts

**Important considerations:**
- Once data is federated, copies exist on remote servers
- We cannot guarantee removal from all federated servers
- Remote servers have their own privacy policies
- You can limit data sharing by using private/followers-only visibility

### Third-Party Service Providers
We may use third-party services for:

| Service Type | Purpose | Data Shared |
|--------------|---------|-------------|
| Hosting Provider | Server infrastructure | All data (encrypted at rest) |
| CDN/Storage | Media delivery | Uploaded files |
| Email Provider | Transactional emails | Email addresses |
| [Others as applicable] | [Purpose] | [Data] |

We require all service providers to maintain appropriate security measures.

### We Do NOT:
- Sell your personal data
- Share data with advertisers
- Use data for targeted advertising
- Provide data to data brokers

## 5. Data Retention

### Active Accounts
- Account data is retained while your account is active
- Content is retained until you delete it or your account

### Deleted Content
- Deleted posts are removed from our database promptly
- Cached copies may persist briefly in CDN/caches
- Federated copies on remote servers are not under our control

### Deleted Accounts
- Upon account deletion, we remove your data within [30 days]
- Some data may be retained for legal compliance
- Backups are rotated out within [90 days]

### Log Data
- Access logs: [30 days]
- Security logs: [1 year]
- Anonymized analytics: Indefinitely

## 6. Your Rights

### For All Users
You have the right to:
- **Access:** Download a copy of your data (Settings â†’ Data Export)
- **Correction:** Update your profile and account information
- **Deletion:** Delete your account and associated data
- **Portability:** Export your data in a machine-readable format

### Additional Rights for EEA/UK Users (GDPR)
- **Object:** Object to certain data processing
- **Restrict:** Request restriction of processing
- **Withdraw Consent:** Where processing is based on consent
- **Complain:** Lodge a complaint with a supervisory authority

### How to Exercise Your Rights
- **Self-service:** Most actions available in Settings
- **Contact:** [privacy@example.com] for other requests
- **Response Time:** Within 30 days of verification

## 7. Cookies and Local Storage

### What We Use
| Type | Purpose | Duration |
|------|---------|----------|
| Session Cookie | Authentication | Session |
| Token Storage | Remember login | [Duration] |
| UI Preferences | Theme, language | Persistent |
| CSRF Token | Security | Session |

### Third-Party Cookies
[We do not use / We use limited] third-party cookies for:
- [List any third-party cookies/analytics]

### Managing Cookies
- Essential cookies are required for the service to function
- Most preferences are stored in localStorage, not cookies
- Clear site data in your browser to remove all stored data

## 8. Security Measures

### Technical Safeguards
- All connections encrypted with TLS (HTTPS)
- Passwords hashed using [bcrypt/argon2]
- Database encryption at rest
- Regular security updates and patches
- Rate limiting and DDoS protection

### Organizational Safeguards
- Limited access to personal data
- Regular security training (if applicable)
- Incident response procedures
- Regular security assessments

### Your Responsibilities
- Use a strong, unique password
- Enable two-factor authentication if available
- Keep your devices and browser secure
- Report security issues to [security@example.com]

## 9. International Data Transfers

### Server Location
Our servers are located in [country/region].

### Cross-Border Transfers
If you access the service from outside [country/region], your data will be transferred to and processed in [country/region].

For EEA users, we rely on:
- [Standard Contractual Clauses / Adequacy decisions / etc.]

## 10. Children's Privacy

This service is not intended for children under 13 years of age (or the minimum age in your jurisdiction).

- We do not knowingly collect data from children
- If you believe a child has created an account, contact us
- Accounts belonging to children will be terminated

We may update this privacy policy from time to time.

### Notification of Changes
- Material changes will be announced via [site announcement/email]
- The "Last updated" date will be revised
- Previous versions available at [link, if applicable]

### Your Continued Use
Continued use after changes constitutes acceptance of the updated policy. If you disagree with changes, you may delete your account.
